oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Full Gospel Tabernacle in Jesus' Name service, 1998 October 10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with music performed by Billy Taylor and a choir of the few congregants in attendance. Music increases tempo and as Jamie Coots sings, members clap and sing along. Jamie Coots is followed by a child who leads the next song. Following the little girl’s song, two female members of the congregation set up the microphone to sing. When the music pauses, Billy Taylor preaches. When his sermon comes to an end Jamie Coots testifies before launching into his own sermon. The testimony of other members follows Coots’ sermon. The recording comes to an end as the congregation lays hands on a child.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Singing -- Religious aspects; Expository preaching; Imposition of hands; Lay preaching; Pentecostal preaching; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Coots, Jamie, (Gregory James), 1971-2014; Taylor, Billy
Full Gospel Tabernacle in Jesus' Name (Middlesboro, Ky.)
